com.paypal.android.sdk.payments
Class PaymentActivity

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
              android.app.Activity
                  com.paypal.android.sdk.payments.PaymentActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
ComponentCallbacks, ComponentCallbacks2, KeyEvent.Callback, LayoutInflater.Factory, LayoutInflater.Factory2, View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, Window.Callback
public class PaymentActivity
extends Activity

Primary Activity for the PayPal Android SDK. Integration point for third party applications.

Responsible for the initiating the transaction & returning the result. You should not attempt to interact with any other activity in this SDK.

Important note:

This is a proof of payment system. You MUST verify all transactions via a call from your servers (not your app) to PayPal's servers, to ensure that the transaction was genuine and successful. The proof of payment will be returned as EXTRA_RESULT_CONFIRMATION.

The activity will have Activity.RESULT_OK if the payment was processed or Activity.RESULT_CANCELLED if the user canceled it. If your app submits an invalid payment, it may return RESULT_PAYMENT_INVALID. All other errors will be handled by the SDK.

Field Detail

EXTRA_CLIENT_ID

public static final String EXTRA_CLIENT_ID
String extra. Required. Get the client id from at developer.paypal.com.

If this extra is not set, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown when the activity is created.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

EXTRA_RECEIVER_EMAIL

public static final String EXTRA_RECEIVER_EMAIL
String extra. Required. This is the email address of the PayPal account that will receive PayPal transactions. It should match the one used to create the client id.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

EXTRA_PAYER_ID

public static final String EXTRA_PAYER_ID
String extra. Optional, but strongly recommended. Uniquely identifies the user in your system.

This extra must be set to remember credit card or PayPal login information.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

EXTRA_PAYMENT

public static final String EXTRA_PAYMENT
Parcelable extra. Required. Contains PayPalPayment payment information.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RESULT_PAYMENT_INVALID

public static final int RESULT_PAYMENT_INVALID
A resultCode returned by Splash indicating that the input PayPalPayment object is not valid. The payment was not attempted. PayPal UI will not be presented.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

EXTRA_RESULT_CONFIRMATION

public static final String EXTRA_RESULT_CONFIRMATION
A PaymentConfirmation parcelable extra containing all of the information your server needs to verify the payment.

ENVIRONMENT_NO_NETWORK

public static final String ENVIRONMENT_NO_NETWORK
Mock environment. Pre-packaged fake transactions only.

The SDK will not attempt to contact PayPal's servers with this environment.

EXTRA_SKIP_CREDIT_CARD

public static final String EXTRA_SKIP_CREDIT_CARD
Boolean extra. Optional. Don't support credit cards. Defaults to false.

If set, the SDK will skip directly to the PayPal login screen.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

EXTRA_DEFAULT_USER_EMAIL

public static final String EXTRA_DEFAULT_USER_EMAIL
String extra. Optional. Pre-populate email login if no other information is available.

If your app has knowledge of the user's email, you can provide it here. However, it may be overridden by PayPal.

See Also:

EXTRA_LANGUAGE_OR_LOCALE

public static final String EXTRA_LANGUAGE_OR_LOCALE
String extra. Optional. The preferred language for all strings appearing in the user interface. If not set, or if set to null, defaults to the device's current language setting.

Can be specified as a language code ("en", "fr", "zh-Hans", etc.) or as a locale ("en_AU", "fr_FR", "zh-Hant_HK", etc.).

If the library does not contain localized strings for a specified locale, then will fall back to the language. E.g., "es_CO" -> "es".
If the library does not contain localized strings for a specified language, then will fall back to American English.

If you specify only a language code, and that code matches the device's currently preferred language, then the library will attempt to use the device's current region as well. E.g., specifying "en" on a device set to "English" and "United Kingdom" will result in "en_GB".

These localizations are currently included:
da, de, en, en_AU, en_GB, en_SV, en_U5, es, es_MX, fr, he, it, ja, nb, nl, pl, pt, pt_BR, ru, sv, tr, zh-Hans, zh-Hant_HK, zh-Hant_TW.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
